navigation

Class Pilot

  • java.lang.Object
    • navigation.Pilot
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Navigator

    public class Pilot
extends java.lang.Object
    All the "dumb" navigation functions which directly control the wheel's motors, it is basically a slight modification of Navigation.java from R&D experiments
    Author:
    Michael

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pilot(Odometer odo) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void goBackward(double distance)
      Go backward a set distance in cm
      void goForward(double distance) 
      void setFloat()
      Float the two motors jointly
      void setSpeeds(float lSpd, float rSpd)
      Functions to set the motor speeds jointly
      void setSpeeds(int lSpd, int rSpd) 
      void travelTo(double x, double y)
      TravelTo function which takes as arguments the x and y position in cm Will travel to designated position, while constantly updating it's heading
      void travelTo2(double x, double y)
      TravelTo function which takes as arguments the x and y position in cm Will travel to designated position, while constantly updating it's heading
      void travelToSlow(double x, double y)
      Same as TravelTo2 but in a very slow speed for accuracy during ball retrieval
      void turnTo(double angle, boolean stop)
      TurnTo function which takes an angle and boolean as arguments The boolean controls whether or not to stop the motors when the turn is completed
      void turnToSlow(double angle, boolean stop)
      Same as TurnTo but with a very slow speed for retrieving the ball accurately
